sub_strands.name: Introduction to Integrated Science
descriptions: Components of Integrated Science as a field of study
Importance of science in daily life (health, agriculture, industry, transport, food and textile and career opportunities)
learning_outcomes: Outline the components of Integrated Science as a field of study
Explain the importance of science in daily life
Show interest in learning Integrated Science at junior school
learning_experiences: Brainstorm on the components of Integrated Science
Use digital or print media to search for more information on components of Integrated Science and share with peers
Discuss the importance of science in daily life
Search for information from print or digital media on pathways related to Integrated Science at Senior School, use locally available materials to construct a career chart and display
key_inquiries: How is the knowledge acquired in Integrated Science useful in daily life?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: The learner develops speaking skills as they discuss the importance of science in daily life.
Self-efficacy: The learner develops effective communication skills as they brainstorm on the components of Integrated Science.
values: Respect: The learner works harmoniously in groups as they discuss the importance of scientific knowledge in daily life.
Unity: The learner cooperates while working in groups as they brainstorm on the components of Integrated Science.
pertinent_issues: Socio-Economic Issues - cyber security: The learner observes cyber security as they search for information on the internet using the digital devices in school.
other_learning_areas: Content on importance of science to career pathways is linked to Pre-technical Studies
non_formal_activities: Watching video tapes on components of Integrated Science as a field of study
Oral speeches on the importance of Integrated Science in daily life

skills.skill: Ability to explain the importance of science in daily life

rubrics.Exceeds: Explains the importance of science in daily life extensively
rubrics.Meets: Explains the importance of science in daily life
rubrics.Approaches: Explains the importance of science in daily life partially
rubrics.Below: Explains the importance of science in daily life partially with prompts

sub_strands.name: Laboratory Safety
descriptions: Common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory (flammable, corrosive, toxic, carcinogenic, and radioactive substances)
Common accidents in the laboratory (burns and scalds, cuts, and ingestion of harmful substances)
Safety measures in the laboratory
learning_outcomes: Identify common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory
Explain causes of common accidents in the laboratory
Demonstrate First Aid measures for common laboratory accidents
Appreciate the importance of safety in the laboratory and access to a healthy working environment
learning_experiences: Brainstorm on common hazards and their symbols
Discuss causes of common laboratory accidents and their related First Aid measures
Role-play some First Aid procedures for common accidents in the laboratory
Practice safety measures in the laboratory and the general school learning environment
Practice laboratory waste management
Discuss the importance of safety measures in the laboratory
Use digital or print media to search for information on laboratory safety procedures
key_inquiries: How do accidents happen in the laboratory?
What safety measures should be considered while working in the laboratory?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: The learner develops relationships while role-playing some First Aid procedures for common accidents in the laboratory

Critical thinking and problem solving: The learner reflects while role-playing some First Aid procedures for common accidents in the laboratory and practises safety measures in the laboratory and the general school learning environment
values: Responsibility: The learner exercises accountability as they practise safety measures in the laboratory and the general school learning environment
pertinent_issues: Socio-economic issue: The learner practises safety precautions in the laboratory
other_learning_areas: Content on causes of common laboratory accidents and related First Aid measures is linked to accidents and First Aid procedures in Home Science
learning_materials: Basic laboratory apparatus, equipment and selected specimens
non_formal_activities: Interacting actively with resource persons to understand issues to do with common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory
Preparing charts, posters and slogans on First Aid safety measures for common laboratory accidents

skills.skill: Ability to identify common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory consistently
rubrics.Meets: Identifies common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory
rubrics.Below: Identifies some common hazards and their symbols in the laboratory with prompts

skills.skill: Ability to demonstrate First Aid measures for common laboratory accidents

rubrics.Exceeds: Demonstrates First Aid measures for common laboratory accidents consistently
rubrics.Meets: Demonstrates First Aid measures for common laboratory accidents
rubrics.Approaches: Demonstrates some First Aid measures for common laboratory accidents
rubrics.Below: Demonstrates some First Aid measures for common laboratory accidents with assistance

sub_strands.name: Laboratory Apparatus and Instruments
descriptions: Basic skills in science (manipulative, observation, measurement, classification, prediction, communication and conclusion skills)
Laboratory instruments and apparatus
International System of Units (SI) for basic and derived quantities in science
learning_outcomes: Describe the basic skills in science
Use and care for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory
Use the SI units for basic and derived quantities in science
Appreciate consumer protection when handling different apparatus, instruments and other materials in day-to-day life
learning_experiences: Discuss the use of basic skills in science

Practice use and care for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory (for heating, measuring mass, temperature, length, volume, weight, magnification and time), including parts, functions and care of a light microscope and parts of a Bunsen burner

Carry out activities on measurements of basic quantities and express them in the International System of Units (length, mass, time, electric current, temperature, amount of substance, light intensity)
Carry out activities to determine derived units from basic units (area, volume, speed, density)
Collect packaging featuring labels of quantities and discuss the importance of the information on labels
key_inquiries: Why are basic skills in science important?
How are quantities in science expressed?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: The learner reflects on their own work as they practise how to use and care for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory
Communication and collaboration: The learner develops teamwork as they collect packaging featuring labels of quantities and discuss the importance of the information on labels
values: Respect: The learner appreciates others’ opinions while working in groups as they discuss the use of basic skills in science
Responsibility: The learner cares for apparatus and instruments as they practise how to care and use them in the laboratory
pertinent_issues: Socio-economic issues: The learner appropriately disposes of any broken equipment as they practise use and care for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory
other_learning_areas: Content on manipulative and measurement skills is linked to measurements of ingredients when preparing meals in Agriculture and Nutrition
Content on measurement skills is linked to measurements of various quantities in Mathematics
learning_materials: Basic laboratory apparatus, equipment and selected specimens (including microscope)
non_formal_activities: Writing articles in school magazines on units (SI) for basic and derived quantities in science
Engaging resource persons in discussing basic science process skills
Engaging resource persons to talk about how to safely handle and use apparatus and instruments in the laboratory

skills.skill: Ability to use and care for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory

rubrics.Exceeds: Uses and cares for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory correctly and accurately
rubrics.Meets: Uses and cares for apparatus and instruments in the laboratory correctly
rubrics.Approaches: Uses and cares for some apparatus and instruments in the laboratory
rubrics.Below: Uses and cares for some apparatus and instruments in the laboratory with assistance

sub_strands.name: Mixtures
descriptions: Homogeneous mixtures (solid-solid, solid-liquid, liquid-liquid and gas-gas)
Separation of homogeneous mixtures (evaporation, crystallisation, simple distillation, fractional distillation, sublimation, solvent extraction and chromatography)
Applications of methods of separating mixtures in real life
learning_outcomes: Separate homogeneous mixtures using appropriate methods
Outline applications of separating homogeneous mixtures in day-to-day life
Appreciate the use of different methods of separating mixtures in day-to-day life
learning_experiences: Identify and record mixtures at school and home in groups
Categorise the identified mixtures as homogeneous or heterogeneous
Discuss meaning of the terms solvent, solute and solution
Carry out activities to separate homogeneous mixtures with peers
Discuss the applications of separating mixtures in day-to-day life
Where possible, use digital devices to observe fractional distillation as a method of separating a mixture of water and ethanol
key_inquiries: How is the separation of mixtures important in day-to-day life?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: The learner works with peers to identify and record different types of mixtures in school and at home
Learning to learn: The learner practises to learn independently as they use appropriate methods of separating mixtures in day-to-day life
values: Unity: The learner cooperates with peers as they work in groups to separate mixtures
pertinent_issues: Socio-economic issues (Financial Literacy): The learner appreciates the economic importance of separation of mixtures as they discuss the applications of separating mixtures in day-to-day life
other_learning_areas: Social Studies: The learner relates traditional methods of separating mixtures to modern methods
learning_materials: Basic laboratory apparatus, equipment and selected specimens
non_formal_activities: Organising and participating in exchange programmes/field trips to distinguish between pure and impure substances using melting and boiling points

skills.skill: Ability to separate homogeneous mixtures using appropriate method

rubrics.Exceeds: Separates all the suggested homogeneous mixtures using appropriate methods
rubrics.Meets: Separates most of the suggested homogeneous mixtures using appropriate methods
rubrics.Approaches: Separates some of the suggested homogeneous mixtures using appropriate methods
rubrics.Below: Separates homogeneous mixtures using inappropriate method

sub_strands.name: Acids, Bases and Indicators
descriptions: Introduction to acids and bases
Identification of acids and bases using a litmus paper
Preparation of acid-base indicators from plant extracts
Classification of commonly used substances as acids and bases using acid-base indicator from plant extract
Physical properties of acids and bases
Uses of acids, bases and indicators in real life
learning_outcomes: Identify acids and bases using a litmus paper
Prepare an acid-base indicator from plant extracts
Describe the physical properties of acids and bases
Outline applications of acids, bases and indicators in real life
Appreciate the uses of acids and bases in real life
learning_experiences: Use litmus paper to classify household solutions into acids and bases
Carry out activities to prepare acid-base indicators from plant extracts, and dispose of laboratory waste responsibly
Use acid-base indicator from plant extracts to classify common household solutions as either acidic or basic
Carry out activities to investigate the physical properties of acids and bases
Where possible, use digital or print media to explore applications of acids and bases and present findings
key_inquiries: Why are acids and bases important?
core_competencies: Critical thinking and problem solving: The learner develops research skills as they explore applications of acids and bases using print or digital media
Self-efficacy: The learner develops self-awareness as they explore applications of acids and bases and present findings
values: Responsibility: The learner engages in assigned roles as they carry out activities to prepare acid-base indicators from plant extracts collaboratively
Respect: The learner appreciates diverse opinions of peers as they collaboratively use digital or print media to explore applications of acids and bases and present findings in plenary
pertinent_issues: Socio-economic issues (Environmental education): The learner carries out activities to prepare acid-base indicators from plant extracts, and dispose of laboratory waste responsibly
other_learning_areas: Agriculture and Nutrition: The content on acids and bases is linked to testing soil acidity and application of lime and fertilisers to improve soil fertility and pH
learning_materials: Basic laboratory apparatus, equipment and selected specimens
non_formal_activities: Engaging resource persons on how to use plant extracts as acid-base indicator

skills.skill: Ability to identify acids and bases

rubrics.Exceeds: Correctly identifies all the provided substances as acids or bases
rubrics.Meets: Correctly identifies most of the provided substances as acids or bases
rubrics.Approaches: Correctly identifies some of the provided substances as acids or bases
rubrics.Below: Correctly identifies a few of the provided substances as acids or bases

skills.skill: Ability to outline applications of acids and bases in real life

rubrics.Exceeds: Correctly outlines all the applications of acids and bases
rubrics.Meets: Correctly outlines most of the applications of acids and bases
rubrics.Approaches: Correctly outlines some of the applications of acids and bases
rubrics.Below: Correctly outlines a few applications of either acids or bases

sub_strands.name: Human Reproductive System
descriptions: Parts of the human reproductive system and their functions (Male: penis, testis and urethra. Female: vagina, cervix, uterus, oviduct, and ovaries)
Changes in boys and girls during adolescence and their implications
How to manage developmental challenges during adolescence (physical, social and emotional)
learning_outcomes: Identify parts of the human male and female reproductive systems
Describe functions of parts of the male and female reproductive system
Describe the physical changes that take place in boys and girls during adolescence
Develop a plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence
Appreciate that physical changes in boys and girls during adolescence have social and reproductive implications
learning_experiences: Use charts and other print materials to observe and identify parts of the human male and female reproductive systems
Discuss the functions of parts of the male and female reproductive systems and share
Use print and non-print material to search for information on physical changes that take place in boys and girls during adolescence and share
Use print and non-print material to search for information on developmental challenges during adolescence and coping mechanisms, discuss and share with peers
Discuss with peers and develop a plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence
key_inquiries: What are the physical, social and emotional changes that take place during adolescence?
How are developmental changes managed during adolescence?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: The learner successfully develops a plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence
Communication and collaboration: The learner contributes to group discussions on the physical changes that take place in boys and girls during adolescence
values: Integrity: The learner shows self-discipline in coping with developmental challenges during adolescence
Respect: The learner appreciates others as they learn about the uniqueness of their bodies
pertinent_issues: Human sexuality: The learner develops the skill of self-awareness as they discuss the developmental challenges during adolescence and coping mechanisms
other_learning_areas: Linked to Agriculture and Nutrition (reproduction in animals)
non_formal_activities: Engaging in straight talk on reproduction in human beings
Engaging a resource person to talk about reproduction in human beings

skills.skill: Ability to describe functions of parts of the male and female reproductive system

rubrics.Exceeds: Describes functions of parts of the male and female reproductive system precisely
rubrics.Meets: Describes functions of parts of the male and female reproductive system
rubrics.Approaches: Describes functions of parts of the male and female reproductive system partially
rubrics.Below: Describes functions of parts of the male and female reproductive system partially with prompts

skills.skill: Ability to develop a plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence

rubrics.Exceeds: Develops an innovative plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence
rubrics.Meets: Develops a plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence
rubrics.Approaches: Develops a simple plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence
rubrics.Below: Develops a sketchy plan to manage developmental challenges during adolescence

sub_strands.name: Human Excretory System
descriptions: Components of the excretory system
Parts of the human skin and their functions
Parts of the urinary system and their functions (external appearance of the kidney, and vessels serving kidney, ureter, bladder, urethra)
Common kidney disorders and their causes
learning_outcomes: Identify parts of human skin and their functions
Identify parts of the urinary system and their functions
Describe causes of kidney disorders
Develop and maintain a daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
Appreciate the need for a healthy lifestyle to promote kidney and skin health
learning_experiences: Use a hand lens to observe the external parts of the skin (hair and sweat pores)

Use a chart or model to discuss parts and functions of the human skin (epidermis, dermis, sweat glands, sweat duct and sweat pore – indicate position of the hair and avoid homeostatic functions of the skin)
Search for information on the waste products excreted through the skin (excess salts and water in sweat), lungs (carbon dioxide) and kidneys (excess salts and water in urine)
Discuss parts of the urinary system and use locally available materials to model the urinary system
Use charts/models/animations to discuss the external parts and functions of the human kidney
Use print and non-print materials to search for information on the causes and prevention of kidney disorders
Search for information on healthy lifestyles that promote kidney and skin health, record and share
Discuss and develop a daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
key_inquiries: What is the role of the excretory system?
How can a healthy excretory system be maintained?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: The learner clearly records and shares information on healthy lifestyles that promote kidney and skin health
Self-efficacy: The learner successfully develops a daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
values: Love: The learner appreciates and embraces their natural skin as they develop and maintain a daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
Unity: The learner shares available resources with others as they study the skin and the kidney
pertinent_issues: Health promotion issues: The learner searches for information on healthy lifestyles that promote kidney and skin health
other_learning_areas: Linked to Agriculture and Nutrition (healthy eating and nutrition for healthy skin and kidneys)
non_formal_activities: Inviting a resource person to talk about how to adopt a healthy lifestyle to promote kidney and skin health
Holding discussions on causes of kidney disorders

skills.skill: Ability to identify parts of the excretory system and their functions

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies parts of the excretory system and their functions comprehensively
rubrics.Meets: Identifies parts of the excretory system and their functions
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies parts of the excretory system and their functions partially
rubrics.Below: Identifies parts of the excretory system and their functions partially with prompts

skills.skill: Ability to develop and maintain a daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health

rubrics.Exceeds: Develops and maintains a purposeful daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
rubrics.Meets: Develops and maintain a daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
rubrics.Approaches: Develops and maintain a simple daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health
rubrics.Below: Develops and maintain a haphazard daily log on activities that promote skin and kidney health

sub_strands.name: Electrical Energy
descriptions: Sources of electricity in the environment
Flow of electric current using simple electric circuits
Common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life
Safety measures followed while using electrical appliances
Use of electricity in day-to-day life
learning_outcomes: Identify sources of electricity in the environment
Demonstrate flow of electric current using simple electric circuits
Identify common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life
Identify safety measures observed when handling electrical appliances
Appreciate the use of electricity in day-to-day life
learning_experiences: Discuss in groups the sources of electricity in the environment

Use print or digital media to search for more information on sources of electricity in nature (hydro-electric power, geothermal, solar, wind power, nuclear, tidal-wave, fossil fuels, biomass, natural gas, electrical cells)
Use electrical apparatus to set up simple electrical circuits in series and in parallel (electrical cells, connecting wires, switch, bulb, bulb holder)
Perform experiments to classify materials as either conductors or non-conductors of electricity

Discuss and identify common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life (pressure cooker, electric cooker, electric blender, electrical lamp and torch, electric iron box, electric kettle, electric guitar, electric fan, air conditioner, electric oven, television, electric speaker, washing machine and electric refrigerator)
Identify and discuss safety measures observed when using electrical appliances
Explore uses of electricity in day-to-day life
Use digital or print media to search for more information on electrical appliances and safety measures observed when using them
key_inquiries: What are the sources of electricity in the environment?
How is electricity used in day-to-day life?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: The learner shares learnt knowledge as they use digital or print media to search for more information on electrical appliances and safety measures observed when using them
Citizenship: The learner exercises responsible use of the different sources of electricity within their locality
values: Unity: The learner works harmoniously with peers as they set up simple electrical circuits in series and parallel
Patriotism: The learner practises dedication in setting up simple electrical circuits in series and parallel while working in groups
pertinent_issues: Socio-economic issues: The learner exercises safety and security in the class and school environment as they identify and discuss safety measures to follow when using electrical appliances
other_learning_areas: Pre-technical and Business Studies: The learner relates concepts developed in electrical energy in setting up simple electrical circuits
learning_materials: Basic laboratory apparatus, equipment and selected specimens
non_formal_activities: Initiating projects on how to set up simple electrical circuits in series and parallel using dry cells, bulbs, ammeters and voltmeters
Writing articles in school magazines on safety measures when handling electrical appliances

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies sources of electricity in the environment extensively
rubrics.Meets: Identifies sources of electricity in the environment sufficiently
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some sources of electricity in the environment
rubrics.Below: Identifies some sources of electricity in the environment with prompt

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life extensively
rubrics.Meets: Identifies common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life sufficiently
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life
rubrics.Below: Identifies some common electrical appliances used in day-to-day life with prompts

rubrics.Exceeds: Extensively identifies safety measures observed when handling electrical appliances
rubrics.Meets: Sufficiently identifies safety measures observed when handling electrical appliances
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some safety measures observed when handling electrical appliances correctly
rubrics.Below: Identifies some safety measures observed when handling electrical appliances with prompt

sub_strands.name: Magnetism
descriptions: Properties of a magnet
Materials as magnetic or non-magnetic
Uses of magnets in day-to-day life
Applications of magnets in day-to-day life
learning_outcomes: Demonstrate the properties of a magnet
Classify materials as magnetic or non-magnetic
Identify the uses of magnets in day-to-day life
Appreciate the applications of magnets in day-to-day life
learning_experiences: Carry out activities to demonstrate properties of a magnet (attractive and repulsive, directional, poles and magnetic strength properties)
Carry out activities to investigate the nature of force between different poles of magnets (basic law of magnetism)
Use a permanent magnet to test different materials, sort and classify them into either magnetic or non-magnetic materials
Discuss the applications of magnets in day-to-day life (separation of mixtures, radios, speakers, refrigerator door, magnetic compass and magnets used in toys to give magic effect)
Use digital or print media to search for more information on applications of magnets in day-to-day life
key_inquiries: How are magnets used in day-to-day life?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: The learner develops communication skills as they discuss the applications of magnets
Self-efficacy: The learner manages assigned tasks by attentively using a permanent magnet to test different materials, sort and classify them into magnetic and non-magnetic materials
values: Responsibility: The learner diligently engages in assigned roles when carrying out activities to investigate the nature of force between different poles of magnets
Respect: The learner exercises patience with one another as they discuss the various applications of magnets
pertinent_issues: Socio-economic issue: The learner enhances environmental education as they use a permanent magnet to test different materials, sort and classify them into either magnetic or non-magnetic materials
other_learning_areas: Linked to Social Studies – the learner links the concept of magnetism to determine direction using a magnetic compass
learning_materials: Basic laboratory apparatus, equipment and selected specimens
non_formal_activities: Engaging resource persons to discuss uses of magnets in day-to-day life
Organising and participating in exchange programmes to identify force between like and unlike poles of magnets

skills.skill: Ability to demonstrate the properties of a magnet

rubrics.Exceeds: Demonstrates the properties of a magnet correctly and consistently
rubrics.Meets: Demonstrates the properties of a magnet correctly
rubrics.Approaches: Demonstrates the properties of a magnet partially
rubrics.Below: Demonstrates some properties of a magnet with prompt

skills.skill: Ability to identify the uses of magnets in day-to-day life

rubrics.Exceeds: Identifies the uses of magnets in day-to-day life extensively
rubrics.Meets: Identifies the uses of magnets in day-to-day life sufficiently
rubrics.Approaches: Identifies some of the uses of magnets in day-to-day life correctly
rubrics.Below: Identifies the uses of magnets in day-to-day life superficially with prompt
